org.intermine.task

Class Dependencies

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      • org.apache.tools.ant.Task
        • org.intermine.task.Dependencies

  • public class Dependencies
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task
    Find and compile/execute dependent project (via the project.properties files)

    • Method Detail

      • setBasedir

        public void setBasedir(java.lang.String basedir)
        Base directory that all projects are assumed relative to.
        Parameters:
        basedir - base directory that all projects are assumed relative to

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(java.lang.String target)
        Set the ant target to execute on each dependency. Targets are not executed if any of the following are true:
        • buildDependencies is set to false
        • the property "no.dep" is set to "true" (the value of this property is set by the Dependencies task and should not be set or altered)
        • nofollow is set to true
        Parameters:
        target - target to run on each dependency

      • setBuildDependencies

        public void setBuildDependencies(boolean build)
        Set whether or not to build project dependencies (default is true).
        Parameters:
        build - false to disable building of dependencies

      • setNoFollow

        public void setNoFollow(boolean nofollow)
        Set whether or not to visit dependencies of dependencies. Default is false - the entire dependency graph is searched.
        Parameters:
        nofollow - true to disable traversal of the dependency graph and to only look at the immediate project dependencies

      • setType

        public void setType(java.lang.String type)
        Set the dependency type. This is basically a way to alter the property read from project.properties identifying project dependencies. The name of the property read will by TYPE.dependencies where, by default, TYPE is "compile". Setting this property to some non-default also has the side-effect of stopping the following of dependencies (in other words it sets nofollow to true).
        Parameters:
        type - type of dependencies to load from project.properties

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException
        Execute the task.
        Overrides:

        public java.lang.String calcThisProjectName()
                                     throws org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException
        Return the project name calculated from the path of this project.
        Returns:
        the project name
        Throws:
        org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if something goes wrong

      • followProjectDependencies

        protected void followProjectDependencies(java.lang.String projName,
                             java.util.List projects,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> extraDeps)
        Load dependencies for a project and iterate over them. Also add the contents of extra.project.dependencies to the start of the projects List.
        Parameters:
        projName - the name of the current project
        projects - accumulation of project names found
        extraDeps - extra dependencies specified by the extra.project.dependencies properties - the "sources" projects sometimes need a model to compile (mostly the postprocessing code), but there is a different model in each Mine so we need to tell the dependency system to add this model project to the dependency list of all projects that we depend on.

      • iterateOverDependencies

        protected void iterateOverDependencies(java.lang.String projName,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> deps,
                           java.util.List projects)
        Step over each dependency mentioned in depsString and record it. Also follow each project once.
        Parameters:
        projName - the name of the current project
        deps - list of project dependencies
        projects - accumulation of project names found

      • loadProjectProperties

        public static java.util.Properties loadProjectProperties(java.io.File projDir)
        Load project properties for given project.
        Parameters:
        projDir - project directory
        Returns:
        Properties object containing project properties

        Given a project name, returning the corresponding project directory.
        Parameters:
        projName - the project name
        Returns:
        the project directory
        Throws:
        org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if the project directory cannot be located
